item.title: Report E-2025030443
item.description:
Report E-2025030443

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2009 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSD. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of "Sodium Hypochlorite" was released from a plastic drum due to improper loading. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3171103. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of UN1791 Sodium Hypochlorite product released impacting wooden trailer floor, concrete and asphalt. The release appears to have been caused by forklift damage which occurred when the pallet the freight was loaded on broke resulting in the drum dropping down into the pallet. The crew utilized absorbents, simple green and water on the impacted areas. The (4) 5-gallon drums were overpacked into an 85-gallon poly drum, impacted absorbents, PPE and impacted plywood were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
